name: Hard Rock Hotel at Universal Orlando

reviews.text: After 6 weeks of traveling the U.S staying in hostels the majority of the time, my friend and I splashed out for 3 nights in the Hard Rock and we are SO glad we did! It was a little expensive for our student budget but well worth every penny we paid.
reviews.title: Lived like a rock star for 3 days

reviews.text: Our room was beautiful. 2 extremely comfortable queen beds, a garden view, a beautiful bathroom, iPod dock and cable T.V. The express pass for Universal and IOA was a fantastic bonus and the parks themselves were only a very short, very pretty walk away, which meant we could easily go between the parks, citywalk and the hotel as often as we fancied. The nightlife in CityWalk was amazing and the closeness of the hotel was fantastic and much appreciated when we had finished partying at 2am!
reviews.title: Totally Worth It

reviews.text: The pool area is beautiful and has such a fantastic atmosphere from morning until night. The staff were all friendly and helpful and did not treat us, a couple of young students, any differently to all the obviously well-off guests in private cabanas. Drinks and food from the marketplace were a little expensive but that is to be expected in a 4 star resort.
reviews.title: Hit or miss

reviews.text: Breakfast was AMAZING- we hadn't eaten so well in weeks! The buffet had everything, from bacon and eggs to waffles and pancakes, pastries, fresh fruit...even pizza! I really could not fault our stay at all. If you want rock star treatment- whether you are traveling with friends, family or as a couple- stay here, you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Great Place, great stay!

reviews.text: This hotel was beyond awesome. Early check-in allowed us to hang out at the parks before our room was ready. Express passes were so worth it during this busy time. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Location was very convient to everything, there was no need to drive anywhere. Water taxi arrived at decent times even the short walk from the hotel to universal was a lovely scroll. I absolutely loved the pool area entertainment and even the fitness area had showers for us to clean up before heading back to a 3hr drive home. This hotel was very afforable and worth every moment. Will definitely return on future visits.
reviews.title: a great stay - well worth the money

reviews.text: Two girlfriends and I decided on the Hard Rock Hotel for a last minute weekend getaway. We got a late start getting on the road, so I called ahead to say that we may not arrive until early in the AM the next day, and they said that was no problem. Upon checking in and getting to our standard room, we immediately noticed that we did not receive the poolview room that I had booked, which is the only reason I rated 4 stars rather than 5. We were too tired to inquire about it that night, so the next morning I went to the front desk and they happily credited me the difference (since we didn't really care to move).
reviews.title: Really great experience!!

likes.disliked: — That it's pet friendly (howling dog near our room woke us up)

reviews.text: We had the breakfast buffet in The Kitchen (hotel restaurant), which was very good and came to about $22/per person including drinks and tip. We really enjoyed the stroll through the Universal grounds to get to the Islands of Adventure park. Make sure you get your park tickets at the hotel. We forgot to do that and had to wait in line with everyone else...and that took a while! Once in the park, we breezed right through all the rides with our hotel key express passes and were finished in only a few short hours! It was really great...we had time to do a lot of other activites throughout the day because of those passes!
reviews.title: Hard Rock is great!

likes.disliked: — The maid didn't wipe down bathroom shelves each day and I noticed it

reviews.text: Parking was $14 a day. I don't know if that is normal or not, but no big deal.
reviews.title: Great location but overpriced

reviews.text: The pool area was gorgeous, although if you're looking to lay in the sun, it is hard to find a good spot because of the abundance of palm trees! We had to move a couple times because the shade from the trees kept falling on us. The pool restaurant and bar opens at 11:00am, and they have very nice servers taking care of you as you sit by the pool. I had a Pina Colada (with a rum floater!) along with a Turkey Wrap, both of which were delicious! We were at the pool on a Sunday, and they had hoola-hoop contests, and water balloon tosses for the kids, and they had the kids doing all sorts of funny dances in the water. We were pretty entertained watching all of this!
reviews.title: Poor Value -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we had a great experience at the Hard Rock and would definitely return!
reviews.title: Fab Location

reviews.text: so this hotel was a lot of fun, only like 2 things were bad. ok i'll start with the bad. 1, room keys didn't work but they were fixed so it wasn't a big deal. 2, no robes in the room. ok, the room was SWEET. it had two comfy beds, and a pullout sofa that was also comfy. i think we got a newly renovated room cuz we had two stereos one with an ipod dock. a sweet flat screen tv and cool color scheme. my boyfriend loved the music under the water at the pool. only ate at the kitchen, and only once. but it was good for the breakfast buffet. cool pic of snoop dogg in the bathroom in the lobby. one time we got lost trying to get to the lobby, but one of the nice employees helped us find it.
reviews.title: fun fun funnnn

reviews.text: me and my family stay here we love it rooms were beauiful the kids love the pool and the waterslide i love how you stay here you can bypass the lines at universal will stay here again
reviews.title: i love hard rock hotel

likes.liked: — the location and the pass to bypass the lines at uniersal
likes.disliked: — that you have to pay for parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic 2 week stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and enjoyed every minute of our honeymoon!
reviews.title: Brilliant Honeymoon!!

reviews.text: We booked through Virgin Holidays in the UK and our reps provided an excellent service in Florida. However, it must be said, that prior to departure their "Call Centre" service is truly unbelievably awful. Basically, Virgin Holidays' call centers seem to be based in India and, in our experience, your advisor will not understand what you are saying, and vice versa... They will NEVER email you, and when we received our tickets they had spelt my fiancee's name incorrectly on the flight tickets. Trying to sort this basic error out was a nightmare worthy of Kafka! I kid you not. It was a disaster and we had no confidence that our Honeymoon would even happen!
reviews.title: 2nd Time back a winner all-around

likes.liked: — Great service, great facility and close to Universal

reviews.text: Luckily, when we arrived at the Hard Rock (5pm ish) our room was ready, we had been upgraded to a Club Room, and check in was excellent. The entire stay was amazing. The pool at the hotel is very very good, the Velvet Bar was a fantastic cocktail bar with great friendly service, the Ice Cream bar was superb, and "The Kitchen" served a wonderful buffet breakfast. The housekeeping service was also excellent, and very friendly. The only 2 downsides were quite simple - the maid service can be late (ie 4 in the afternoon but that is cool really isn't it?), and the Beach "Pool" Bar service is very inept. Even though the hotel was not at peak time the Beach Club service was slow, disorganized, and lackluster.
reviews.title: loved the hard rock!

reviews.text: Just came back from 8 days and 8 nights at Universal. We had a great time. We stayed at the Hard Rock the whole time. It can't be beat for location. Its 5 minutes from the entrance to universal, and 7 minutes from either the farthest corner of City walk, or the other theme Park, Islands of Adventure. Rock Music permeates the facility. We liked this (although there was not enough Led Zeppelin... but thats our taste). Nevertheless, the rooms are quiet. We stayed on the 7th floor (the concierge level). We arrived at the Orlando Airport at 10:15 AM. The pick up service was great (Quick Transportation is the name of the company). They met us at the airport, had a sign with our name... it was very convenient. They were also very reliable in taking us back to the airport at the end of the week. This service kills Disney's Mears transportation. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 11:30 AM and our room was not ready. We spent the next 4 hours in the Parks, we got a voice message that our room was ready and we went back to the hotel to unwind. Our entourage included me (Dad) and my 15 year old and 11 year old sons. We had originally ordered a deluxe room with 2 queen size beds and a pullout couch. We got upgraded to the concierge level (I'm not sure why) with the same bed configuration. The room is big, clean, and comfortable. There is a high grade stereo table top radio that has a very good sound and has an attachment for an IPOD, something my 15 year old immediately took advantage of. The sound is almost as good as a Bose table radio. The large LCD TV was great. The 2 queen beds are very very comfortable, but the pullout couch (regular size bed), was uncomfortable even with a second mattress and comforter under the sleeper (both requested when we realized how uncomfortable this pullout was). Unfortunately, even my 11 year old could not sleep on it. We took turns. The hotel said they did not have a regular mattress to put on the pullout couch. The pool looks picturesque (see the brochure) but it is a novelty pool. You really can't swim in it... at least not very much. The deepest portion is a little over 4 feet, but most of the pool is about 3 ft deep or less. Yes there are underwater speakers, but it ended up not being that big a deal after the 8th time we dunked our head under the water to listen. The long slide (also advertised) is very long, but not steep. Adults have trouble getting started unless they lie down in the begining of the run. Pool side entertainment during the late afternoon is geared towards the under 10 crowd (i.e hula hoop contests and adults are excluded). There is a few nights of poolside movies after 8 PM and a few nights of live poolside rock music. The live music is okay, my son recognized the names of the groups, I didn't. When I booked the hotel (through Universal vacation package), I was told that there is a shuttle service between Sea World and "Wet and Wild" (the associated water park), so I bought the 4 park 14 day tickets. Well I guess there is a shuttle (I was thinking Disney), but I was mislead. The shuttle leaves the hotel at 9:55 AM to go to the water park and sea world and subsequently leaves Sea World at 7:00 PM and Wet and Wild at 5:00 PM. Thats right one pickup and one return (not every 20 or 30 minutes as I incorrectly envisioned). The bus (also unlike disney) has a sign encouraging the riders to tip the bus driver when they arrive at their destination. The taxi ride one way to Sea World is $15,50, and $5.50 to Wet and Wild (without a tip). We took the bus once to sea world, but after that we took taxi's. The hotels restaurants are excellent. The "Kitchen's" (name of one of the restaurants) breakfast buffet is as good as any upmarket breakfast and fits the quality of the hotel, The Steak at the "Palm" restaurant was remarkable for its taste and tenderness... and it was cooked "medium well" as requested.
reviews.title: Its Rock and Roll

reviews.text: Service was excellent. The concierge breakfast buffet was okay, bagels, fruit, cereal, pastries (mostly cheap donuts)... but is nothing special. The late afternoon buffet was a mixed bag, some days it was great, and some days it was mediocre. It was convenient to be able to run over to the concierge lounge at any point in the day and get a good cup of coffee. We would stay at this hotel again (and plan to), but not for 8 days. We will skip the concierge level unless given to us again. Although not part of this hotel review, what we did discover is that there is not enough to do at Universal properties to last 8 days, but the details of this are for another review. Our room key allowed us to go to the head of the line for almost every ride... NO WAITS. This perk alone is worth staying on property. Think about this, there are about 9 real rides per park, 10 minutes per ride, and no wait. How long do you think it takes to go on every ride in both parks. Try 6 hours including walking (8 hours on a busy day and 5 hours on Monday).
reviews.title: A Rocking Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from April 26 - 30 2007. Check-In was fast, room was clean, Pool was great, We will be going back to this hotel.
reviews.title: What a place!

likes.liked: — Superb location; great staff and service
likes.disliked: — Pool was too shallow to swim in

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we felt like nothing was too much trouble for any member of the Hard Rock staff. We arrived at around 11.00 am, not expecting our room to be ready but hoping to go straight into the parks for some fun. There was no line at check in; Rachel the receptionist was extremely helpful and arranged for our laptops to be stored in the strong room while the rest of our bags were checked in with the bell desk. We were given our room keys (the all important requisite for the Express line in the parks!) and told we would be phoned once the room was ready.
reviews.title: Mostly good

likes.disliked: — noisy crowd, self-parking, expensive food, $3 coffee, sloppy pool area

reviews.text: 5 minutes later we were walking through the wonderful grounds to the parks. 15 minutes later my husband and daughter were riding the Hulk coaster! Hotel called while we were riding Jurassic Park so I called them back and they immediately confirmed our room number and said they looked forward to seeing us upon our return from the park.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — kids suite, pool and food and music

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hard Rock. From the minute we arrived we were treated like royalty! We got to the hotel about 12:15pm and our room was ready! It was all the way at the end of the hall (it took loger to get to our room then it did to walk to Universal Studios!) - but it was quiet, and an awesome room!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

likes.liked: — Staff was great! parks are even better!

reviews.text: The Express pass / room key was worth the price we paid for the hotel!! We rode the Mummy 4 strait times, with NO wait!! If you are not staying at the Universal hotels, you can purchase an Express pass for about $20 -pp, but you can only go on each ride once. With your room key, it's unlimited!! Loved both parks - this place is awesome. Dined at all the restaurants in Universal - Nascar was good, Hard Rock had good food, NBA City was terrible, Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville ok, nothing special; The Palm was as good as always, but the best part of trip was Mama Della's - at the Portifino. My husband and I really aren't into italian food, but EVERYONE said if you can afford it, that's the place to go. So we went on our last night there (you need rservations). It was AWESOME! The service was great, the appetizers, house / complimentary salad were AMAZING (one of the best I've ever had and I eat out a lot), the dinner was even better (large portions), and the dessert was so tasty (made fresh daily in-house) we almost ordered seconds. If I knew it was going to be that good, we would have dined there more than once.
reviews.title: Disappointed with hotel service

likes.disliked: — Poor service from front desk staff,high price for accomodations

reviews.text: The only problem with the Hard Rock is the pool - we couldn't swim because the water is only 3 feet deep. There is no "adult" section, it's all for kids. We layed in the chairs at night (and there were still 50 people there swimming!) and listened to the music - they have nightly DJ's and there was a movie night (Spiderman).
reviews.title: Hotel is disappointing the second time around

likes.liked: — Within walking distance to Universal theme parks

reviews.text: If you are staying at the Hard Rock - there is no need for the water taxi service - you could be at the park and on a ride before the boat gets you there (it's that close).
reviews.title: Rock On

reviews.text: We booked our trip on Universal's website - maybe that's why we were treated so well - I been on vacations that I have booked on Expedia or Travelocity, and are usually treated like second-class citizens.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2012. The hotel is very clean and has a fun atmosphere. My kids loved the pool and all the rock and roll decorations. Your room key is an express pass to cut in front of the lines at most but not all of the rides. We were able to go on any ride without much of a wait. That benefit alone makes the price almost worth it. The hotel is located right in the middle of both Universal theme parks and the Universal City Walk. It was a great time and if you can save up for it then I highly recommend staying here for at least a couple of days. Eating at the hotel is very pricy. You are better off taking the water taxi over to City Walk and eating there.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth the money.

reviews.text: Wow .. What an amazing stay. We booked the Hard Rock for 3 nights while in Florida for a family vacation.. And moved on to Clearwater beach Florida... Well we miss it already... We are at the beach trying to figure out a way to check out early and get back to the hard rock before we go home. Everything was great .. Nothing you request is not accommodated ... The pool area is awesome ... Something for everyone at this resort. I wish I had spent my entire vacation at the hard rock.
reviews.title: I wanna to back !!!

reviews.text: My family and I have been staying at the Hard Rock Orlando every summer for the last nine years. The hotel's location is excellent! Extremely convenient for Universal Studios and a good location for other Orlando attractions as well. The atmosphere is fun and laid back. The pool is fantastic!! A couple of years ago they improved the pool seating by designating smoking areas, so you didn't have your lounging by the pool constantly ruined by smoke from people next to you. The rooms are nicely appointed and a good size. Each room has a full bath (sink, tub/shower, and toilet) plus an additional sink outside the main bathroom. This can make getting ready a little faster. The staff is attentive and polite with a "rocker" appearance. The boat shuttles work well, but won't run if there's a storm in the area (lightning). The walk to Universal is 5-10 minutes and the walk to Islands of Adventure is 8-12 depending on your speed. We typically arrive, check in, park the car and basically leave it until we're ready to check out. If you need something there are a couple of restuarants on Kirkman. ou can get to them by turning on Major Drive. Also, there's a Target just a couple of exits east on I-4 by the Mall of the Millenia. My only complaint (and it's minor) is that they really like their parking. It's ~$16/night for self-park. Also, not a complaint, but just to let you know, you need your room key to get in or out of the parking lot.
reviews.title: Great for the Family

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way! The location, close to the Universal Studio parks is excellent, not least if you want to experience the world of Harry Potter early in the morning, without standing in line. On top of this, the surroundings are beautiful, the pool is divine and the food on offer is really good. We liked it so much that we came back a second time!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.text: Myself, my little sister, and my housemate spent 5 days at the Hard Rock, on the Club 7 floor. The first day, right after check in, I walk into my room to find three pieces of trash in the corner and dirt in the bath tub. The next night, I left a plate of cookies above the minibar so that I could eat them in the morning. However, halfway through the night they were swarming with ants. The club room attendant was nonexistent and rarely helpful, and the provided desserts, drinks were very subpar for the money and illusion set by the hotel. The internet (for 10$ a day per device in each room) was spotty at times, and overpriced for the 3 hours or so we were able to use it.. the price for having to work on one's vacation, I guess. The room service was flavourful but slow, however it was dulled by the dusty smell, and when walking through the room the first time, I felt debris on the floor under my feet. The workers on my floor would give input to our conversations through the door, and the very thin walls bothered me.. thinner and easier to hear through than the cheap hotel I stayed at inbetween flights. We had to keep the television on (and loud) to block out the noise of the neighbouring room having sex. The bed was extremely hard, uncomfortable The positive notes would include the lobby and adjoining restaurants, the pool, the Jacuzzi, and the exercise room. The spa was absolutely horrible, the manicurist cut my skin giving the manicure and the paint job was something I could have done better myself. The "massage" was absolutely worthless. I would not choose this hotel again, ever, nor the other Loews hotels.
reviews.title: Club 7 @ Hard Rock Orlando

reviews.text: We just returned from 4 nights/5 days at the Hard Rock in Orlando. Overall, my husband, daughter (age 11) and I were very pleased with the hotel. We had a kid suite that gave us lots of room (two bedrooms and shared bath) - it was expensive but worth it. The staff at the hotel were the best part of our stay. They were exceptionally friendly and always willing to help. The hotel itself was nice and fun. As you'd expect, it's definitely geared towards a younger crowd with great music and hip decor. We hit the pool each day after the parks and it was comfortable. It's a lagoon pool so it has a pretty large surface area but not deep. (Note - we were there Mar 9 -13 so the hotel and park were not jammed yet with Spring Break visitors. We talked to a few of the staff who said that in a couple of weeks both the hotel and parks will be chaos...) We ate at the Kitchen for breakfast and the food was good but pricey - $50 for breakfast for the 3 of us. We also had drinks at Velvet and enjoyed a little adult time and beverages. The location is perfect for Universal Studios, City Walk and Islands of Adventure - about a 5 minute walk from the hotel to the park. If we go to Universal Orlando again, we would definitely stay at the Hard Rock.
reviews.title: Good choice for Universal Orlando
love the Hard Rock!
reviews.text: Just got back from 4 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando in early March. We all loved it!!! The hotel was simply beautiful. The rooms were very nice. Comfortable beds, nice shower, thick towels. Every staff member we encountered could not have been nicer. LOVED getting my Starbucks fix every morning from Emak and Bolio's. The weather was a little chilly, so we did not get as much pool time as we would have liked. The water slide was a big hit for my son. The location is also fabulous! Short walk to either Universal Studios or Islands of Adventure and the water taxi's come pretty frequently if your feet get tired.

The only down side was the prices of the food. For the 3 of us, the buffet breakfast was over $50. Drinks by the pool were also expensive. I think it was $10 for a purple people eater drink. (If you can drive from the hotel, there is a Golden Corral about 2 miles away. Only $30 for breakfast for a party of 4, worth going off site). And the $14 per day to park your vehicle was a little exessive considering they do not watch your car. Someone put a large dent in the door of our vehicle. So watch where you park!
reviews.title: Good and BAd

reviews.text: Had dinner at Emeril's Orlando. Save your money!!! Ordered the filet mignon medium well, slightly pink in the middle and it came back like a charcoal briquette!!! Our party was pretty much done with their meal by the time the manager came over and offered me another steak. I told him no thanks, but they did take if off our bill.
reviews.title: kids had a blast at the hard rock

likes.disliked: — hearing everything going on outside our room

reviews.title: not as good as it use to be
reviews.text: If you get the chance, go to Bubba Gump Shrimp Company. The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. The best part was our waiter. Very knowledgable about the movie Forrest Gump and keep quizzing us. My 10 year old son could not get enough of the trivia questions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hard Rock hotel is just wonderful. Everyone who works at the hotel acts as a personal assistant to you. It is not like Disney where you are just a number. This is a fun lively hotel. I would not reccomend this to people looking to relax, although I was able to relax jus fine, because there wasn't much going on. Upon check-in my key's did not work for the room, but someone let me in within 2 minutes. Also, the toilet did not work (this is a VERY common problem with any hotel because of having so many rooms.) but that also was fixed within about 5 minutes. The proximity to the parks is great. Being able to walk beats wating for the watrer taxi (Like staying at the Portofino, which I have stayed at.) The rooms are gorgeous and bright. Having 2 sinks works well for me. We had a coffee maker, cd player, fridge, ipod player and internet hook-ups in the room. We had a great view of the pool (which you pay more for.) I would reccommend this to everyone staying in Universal.
reviews.title: Hard Rock is awesome!!!

reviews.text: Hotel grounds and lobby are nice, there is no in hotel entertainment at night, if you want that, then just go to the citywalk, with all the people paying only 50.00 a night!! we stayed in a ground floor room, with nothing to see but trees, room was worth 100.00 not 250.00, its location to the rest of universal is it's major plus, compared with other hard rocks, hollywood florida for example the rooms here are quite inferior. very overpriced!
reviews.title: It;s not all that, its the location your paying for!

likes.disliked: — the room, and the price of it!

reviews.title: Perfect...almost
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from 15 November - 20 November, and I can honestly say it was the best hotel I have stayed in, in my entire life.

reviews.title: Noisy
reviews.text: Check in was almost instant - none of the problems which I have read on here. We were given a room on the 4th floor, and considering it was the cheapest room you can buy, it was massive - pleanty of space for the two of us, two large double beds and a very spacious bathroom, with an extra sink. It had been recently rennovated and included a large flatscreen TV (American news rules!)

The room was exceptionally clean, and was serviced every day with fresh towels, and Hard Rock Hotel soap (which we 'stole' a few of). No complaints with the room whatsoever. The staff were extremely friendly - much friendlier than UK staff - always smiling, and wishing you a nice day, and very knowledgable of the area when we asked where the nearest shops, restaurants and Walmart were.
reviews.title: I was worried!!

likes.liked: — Trendy, clean, friendly, easy to use

reviews.text: I have many things to say about the loewsfirst program and the hardrock hotel. I made my reservations three months in advance and am a platinum member, loews platinum members are to receive a loewsfirst suite guaranteed at the time of reservation. We checked in late on 4-7-07 went to our room and had a disabled kids suite over looking the roof top with spot lights shining in our windows, the bathroom was together so two people could not get ready at same time, this room was not together in layout of kids suite, sinks were seperated from tub in layout. Toliet was not on ground made a noise when you sit on it, mold by shower, smell was gross!!!!!!!!! I did call down to front desk and talk to julyo the night manger on duty, he told me he was sorry but there was nothing he could do. I was also told i had a better room than i was guaranteed as a loews member any way, so that was a nice way to say take it and shut up. Anyone can read loews benifits on their web and see the kids suite was the room i had the rights to until they change there wed site, The hotel told me i only had the benifits for a premium room, thats wrong according to the loews web site. the fact is I was treated rude and disrespectful, not prestigious like loews says you will be treated, we had to ask twice for our welcome gift before we received it, I had stayed in their hotels for the pasted six years to work my way up to a suite level. please don't bother with loews first program it's a rip off. The express pass is nice to have but if you want to be treated prestigious without having to be in a club, stay at the ritz carlton grandlakes and buy your express pass.
reviews.title: Loewsfirst

reviews.text: We had a great family vacation at the Hard Rock Hotel April 2nd through 7th.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation

likes.liked: — Easy access to the Universal theme parks and 'express' lines at the parks.

reviews.text: We were in a Club level room on the 7th floor with a view of Universal Studios. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. Prior reviews have complained about noise but we didn't experience a problem. We were far away from the elevators, just a couple rooms from the end of the hallway. On the Club floor you have access to the "Club 7" lounge which had complimentary continental breakfast (bagels, donuts, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, coffee, juice), evening drinks and hors d'ouevres from 5pm to 7pm and an evening sweet snack (cookies, brownies, and ice cream were selections while we were there.) Additionally, sodas, bottled water and coffee were available all day.
reviews.title: Quieter, Nicer and Just as Hip as Anticipated

reviews.text: The pool area was lovely but when arriving in the afternoons we were never able to get a lounge chair. They were all occupied or 'reserved' with towels. We were there over spring break so perhaps it's better at slower times of the year. The pool itself is very shallow with a zero-entry edge and a great waterslide for adults and kids alike. The water was very warm, almost like bathwater.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing - You should read this

reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the location of the hotel can't be beat if you are planning to visit the Universal parks. It's about a 10-minute stroll (through gorgeous landscaping) to Universal Studios and another 5 minutes more to Islands of Adventure. There is also a free water taxi and pedicycles. Having access to the express lanes at the parks was wonderful....we rarely waited more than 10 minutes (during Spring Break!)
reviews.title: We had a great time!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hard Rock with my family and it exceeded my expectations and much much more. The staff was extremely polite and helpful from the second we stepped on the property. They were there to help out in any way possible and made sure we were having a great experience and all our needs were being met. The recently renovated room was one of the best rooms I have ever seen. All the way from the giant flat screen TV, huge comfortable bed, lovely sofa and decorations, to the clean, immaculate granite bathroom. The hotel pool was incredible and a great way to spend a day in the sun. The property's location to Islands of Adventure, Universal, and Citywalk made for plenty of entertainment options for the kids and adults at night. This will definitely not be my last trip to the Hard Rock because the entertainment, amenities, luxurious rooms simply can't be beat!!
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently returned from a stay at the Hard Rock in Orlando the end of September. We travel every year for Halloween Horror Nights. My boyfriend has two young children and we play like teenages. However, I travel on business and I am used to the perks of staying on a concierge level floor. Upon arrival we upgraded to the club level expecting concierge floor sophistication. IF THIS IS WHAT YOU ARE LOOKING FOR, THINK AGAIN. The club lounge is constantly over run by children and families looking for free food and drinks. It is consistently out of supplies and does not provide the relaxing atmosphere one might expect when they pay over $100 a night to upgrade to a concierge level floor. I agree with the 8/28/06 review I read upon my return. If you are traveling with children and like the idea of taking advantage of the hotel's club level offerings and raping the other hotel guests of an opportunity to enjoy a nice atmosphere, then you should most definitely book the club level room. If you are looking for a place to have an adult, sophisticated environment, save your money. You will not find it here. The club level rooms should be described more accurately to the hotel guests by management as associated with a play lounge for the kids. That being said, we loved the hotel and had a wonderful stay. We just won't waste our money on the club level next time, unless we bring our kids.!
reviews.title: KIDLESS TRAVELERS BEWARE - Don't book club level

reviews.text: Before I start, I want everyone to know I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel 4 different times and go to Universal several times a year. I have stayed at many properties around Universal and Disney, some very good and some that were horrible. Always remember a vacation or trip is what YOU make it, as a business traveler I experience "bumps" along the way almost every trip I make (30-40 trips a year).
reviews.title: Important!!Read the true Hard Rock Hotel Review

likes.disliked: — Buy a Season Pass for Universal

reviews.text: Having said this I will proceed, The Hard rock is a wonderful hotel full of energy and music. If you have teenagers, they will love the place, if you are bringing grandma and granpa, they will probably hate it. If you are looking to save money, stay somewhere else, IT IS Pricey. I hate when people complain at the price of cokes, food, parking, etc., when they book a room at $260 dollars a night. HELLO??? If you pay that much for a room, do you really think everything at the hotel is going to be cheap?? Also, people complain about the noise??? It is the Hard Rock Hotel, at a Theme Park with kids, kids, kids, did I mention kids?? This is not the Best Western on some deserted highway in Arizona. The Hard Rock is downtown at Party Central, this place does not go to bed until late, if you can't handle it, it is probably best you stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Worst two nights of our vacation

likes.disliked: — dirty rooms, maintenance problems with room and no managemnt intervention

reviews.text: I will now address other issues that always seem to come up about the Hard Rock.
reviews.title: Keep on rocking

likes.liked: — Very spacious public spaces like the lobby. Good sized guest bedrooms. Buffet breakfast
likes.disliked: — Gym was a bit tired and one had to pay $6 for the privilege

reviews.text: First I should mention that I am a travel agent and went to stay at Hard Rock for 3 nights so that I could become acquainted with that property as well as Loews other two properties next door(Royal Pacific & Portofino Bay). We also stayed for 4 nights at Disneys Yacht Club which I will write a seperate review of.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful property

likes.disliked: — noise level in rooms. Vey loud..

reviews.text: Although I am mentioning positive & negative things some of these may/may not be important to all of you.
reviews.title: Hooked on Hard Rock!!!

likes.liked: — Everything about Hard Rock is amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive:
reviews.title: Hotel is lovely, but encountered a few problems
Hard Rock Exceeded Expectations
reviews.text: Check in- very quick & efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms- We stayed in a standard room (not club level). The rooms were of decent size with new updated furnishings. Very clean and turn down service was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Four Star hotel??? Please!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This facade of a nice hotel gives you the service of a motel 6, and that's being polite!
reviews.title: What service?

reviews.text: At check in we encountered several issues, by the time the room was finally ready it wasn't even cleaned, we spoke to "Sonja" at the front desk who served us up a heaping plate of attitude as if waiting an additional 40 minutes after the check in time was to be expected and accepted.
reviews.title: Fun Place, and I Love the Short Lines

likes.liked: — The room key allows you to skip lines at the theme parks.
likes.disliked: — A little pricy, but not much.

reviews.text: I stayed at the club level, disgusting all the way! The concierge's lack of knowledge was almost comical. We were often sent to the 3rd floor to speak to the lobby concierge, they were ok until we encountered their supervisor Patricia, she wasn't dressed like the other concierges but her attitude was absolutely rude. She made it quite obvious that was was not a hotel employee but that of Universal and if we had any issues to fill out a complaint form that she would fax to her superiors.
reviews.title: Why do most people complain?

likes.liked: — Hotel atmosphere, location, front of the line access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily we only stayed for 2 nights, do we plan on staying at Universal ever again, HARDLY!
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!

likes.disliked: — Dine in the Kitchen - good value for money

reviews.text: All other Loews properties we have stayed in have been excellent, this Hard Rock Hotel was a major dissapointment. Both concierge need more training, the house keeping department needs to actually do their job.
reviews.title: It does Rock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are adults with no children and have 2 dogs. All the Universal hotels are awesome, particularly the hard rock. I like the Royal Pacific the most, as it has the least amount of children running around and screaming, but the Hard Rock is my favorite as far as ambience. If you are a music fan, the memoribilia alone will keep you busy for hours. We LOVE being able to take our 2 small dogs with us and will not stay in a hotel where we can't take the mutts. They cater to pet lovers and we reward them with our continued business. The hotel itself is the definition of cool. Modeled after the eagles hotel california it is almost like a rock stars palatial estate. The restaurants and bars are always great and the bartenders are super cool and generous with the tequila. The Hard Rock music venue is easily walkable an we always stay at the hard rock when we go there and see a show. The performers stay at the hard rock hotel and you can usually catch them hanging in the Velvet bat after the show. My wife got to meet Bonnie Raitt when she performed there and we drank with the band after the show. We have stayed on the universal properties about 15-20 times in the last 5 years and have loved it every time. Unlike the enormous Disney, Universal is centered around the closely located base of Universal city walk. You can easily walk from any of the hotels to any of the theme parks and restaurants in about 5 minutes. they also have water taxis if you donlt want to walk and sweat to death in july and august. Emerils Tchoup Chop at the royal pacific is amazing and even the theme restaurants like margaritaville are great. Universal feels like a connected small town that you can walk.The lone drawback is the pool at the hard rock...it is so cool that everyone that stays in any of the 3 hotels at universal usually ends up at the hard rock pool. It is HUGE and has a great water slide. If you want to relax an enjoy it though, forget it. Even the hot tubs are full of 8-14 year olds. if you enjoy hearing "like" 17 times in each sentence and unsupervised children splashing hot tub water up your nose, it's right up your alley. We usually truck on over to the royal pacific and kick back in their pool even when we stay at the hard rock. room servce is great as well. If you want to go to the parks, staying at the universal hotels is MUST. Even though it expensive to stay there, imaging being able to be in your room 5-10 minutes after leaving the park exhausted AND your room key lets you take the hotel entrance and bypass all the regular schlubs standing in line for rides. I think our longest wait at islands of adventure was 10 minutes for the hulk. Always awesome stays, but $$$.
reviews.title: Awesome adult experience, with caveats.

reviews.text: My family - husband, plus two boys ages 6 and 9 and a daughter of 3 stayed here for a week in February. The hotel was as expected and as described on its web site. The pool was great, lots of space to lounge, have a drink and watch the kids swim safely. There was also a life guard on duty to ease any nerves. My daughter was able to paddle around the baby pool happily and the larger pool has a gently sloping side to it, making it easy for her to get in and out of. My only negative about the pool, was the pool service for drinks for food took far too long. They seemed to have plenty of staff, it just took forever for them to bring you your order and then bring you your check. We stayed on club level 7, which has a lounge for breakfast, which is well worth the extra cost as it saved us having to go out and find food so early in the morning. In the evening they had happy hour from 5-7, but it was a bit of a scrum to be honest, with lots of people jostling for food - snacks, appetizers etc and free wine and beer. So we gave it a miss after our first attempt to get some cookies for the kids. We ate at the kitchen restaurant twice, once indoors and once on the patio, which was much nicer. The food here was good, with excellent service and good childrens choices. I would say the best thing about staying here was the ability to use your room key to bypass all the lines. We never stood in line for any rides, it was really fantastic. My kids loved it. I would say if you are coming to Universal, stay on property as the extra cost is very much worth it for convenience, especially with kids and no waiting in line The walk from our hotel to the park took less than 10 minutes, it was very scenic, or you could take the water shuttle, which was only 2 mins. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who is visiting Orlando as even if you want to visit Disney, you could do so by car from here - which we did on one of our days. Great hotel, great location, nice staff and wonderful places to eat. One tip - don't bother eating at the Hard Rock Cafe - food and service was awful. I would recommend the Mythos restaurant in the park though for lunch - really was awesome, great food and not too expensive. We had a wonderful weeks vacation.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay if you are visiting Universal Studios

likes.liked: — The ability to use your room key to bypass all the lines at Universal
likes.disliked: — slow service at the pool and the lounge on floor 7 was a bit of a scrum

reviews.text: My husband and I brought our 3 teenage boys here for 5 nights in February 2008 for their Spring Break. We stayed here strictly because they wanted to go to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure/Wet & Wild. This hotel is a great choice if you have teenage kids and want to go to the parks. Universal is within walking distance and the hotel will provide free shuttle service to the 2 other hotels on the Universal property.
reviews.title: Great location and perks, but not really a Loews experience

likes.disliked: — quality of room, cleanliness of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pros: The location is great and the kids really loved the cool "rock and roll" feel of the hotel. I was impressed that eery single employee was super friendly and went out of their way to be so. The service was top notch so they must be doing something right as far as training their employees. While the kids went to the park my husband and I stayed by the pool most days, and the pool is outstanding. They have a sandy beach pool which was heaven, and there were plenty of friendly servers who provided efficient service with drinks and food. The Palm restaurant is on premises and we dined there 2 nights. The food is outstanding by New York standards (we eat at The Palm in NYC all the time). In fact, the food throughout the hotel is excellent. We had breakfast every morning at The Kitchen and lunch by the pool every day and it never disappointed. We also got a ride one night to the Bice Restaurant at the Portofino Hotel on night and the food and service there was excellent as well. Yes, we all gained a few pounds on this vacation but it was worth it! The kids used their room keys for "express" access at the park to get to the front of the lines and they loved it.
reviews.title: great perks

reviews.text: The Cons: I am Loews First Gold member and I have stayed at many Loews properties and although there are many positives about this hotel, I was disappointed with the quality, and the feel of the room furnishings. The bed felt cheap and hard, and the linens were rough and felt like sheets from a Days Inn. There were obvious stains on the carpet and they politely advise you that the sheets will only be changed every 3 days. I felt that the housekeeper did a less than adequate job cleaning the bathroom and room.
reviews.title: the Hard Rock.....Rocks !!!

reviews.text: Our experience with the Hardrock was not the best, We did travel over Easter break a very busy time. Keep in mind we were paying over$600.00 a night for a room. The place when we got there had people passed out or passsing out sick in the lobby and halls.We were suppossed to stay on the concierge floor but they only had one room full of smoke and filthy, so they put us on 3rd floor right by elevators for the whole hotel. As you have heard in other posts the Hardrock is extremely loud in hallways. Dont ever stay on 3rd floor that is were the lobby is too loud.We travel alot and have never complained but this resortwas the worst ever at that price. Staff said they would move us but it took over 24hors and no apologies. We never got to stay on the floor that we reserved and paid for. We tried to order from room service eggs benedict which is on there menu but the order taker didnt know how to enter it again we gave up. The concierge room was nice and fully stocked it would be worth the extra money if on that floor. The y served breakfast,drinks, nice appetizers and cookies plus another dessert each night. Food quality was very good. The fast pass was nice but can be bought at parks. So my suggestion stay at a cheaper hotel which I am sure is nicer and buy your fast pass. Hardrock is also run down , most carpet needs replaced as well as style. We also stayed at clearwater Beach sandperal for $300 brand new a true luxury resort.We ate at Jimmy Buffets Margaritiville fun and great food in citywalk. Good Luck with Hard rock They need to do some work to charge those prices.
reviews.title: Old and smoky

reviews.text: The hotel is great,rooms need help. If you are going to Universal stay at one of the on site hotels. You get to jump to the front of the line on rides. We went for 1 night over spring break and the pass saved us.
reviews.title: great hotel, bad rooms

likes.disliked: — peeling paint,thin walls, stained bedspreads and dirty tub

reviews.title: Weekend at the Hard Rock Orlando
reviews.text: Hard Rock is a cool hotel with great pool. Only thing is the rooms need help. Walls are so thin you can hear everything-people in next room and people in the hall all night. Peeling paint, stained bedspreads and pillows, dirty tub.
Ate at The Kitchen restaurant, do not recommend. Had the special Chicken Marsala,awful, only good thing was desserts and visit from Scooby Doo.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: This is the second time I have stayed at the Hard Rock. We received a pretty decent rate around $214 per night. (Florida Resident Rate) The public areas and staff at the front desk were just fine. The room itself and the halls are beginning to show their age. The room could have been cleaner. The decorative pillows and comforter had stains on them. The room also was not made up until after 4pm on our first day. Made it a bit crazy to get ready for our evening activites. The ride express pass for the theme park attractions included with the room and the hotel's location to Universal theme parks is worth the extra money required to stay at this hotel. All in all, I would stay again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Booked 2 nights here to go to Universal and Islands with 2 day park hopper. Cant beat the location, pool area is great. Ideal for going to the parks and taking a pool break in the middle of the day. When i booked I was told a garden view room would be big enough for 5 with 2 queens and a cot, well it isnt. they gave us the hospitality suite for same price, but that had only a queen sofa bed and they gave us 4 cots at no charge. The room was great but the beds were not. I asked about staying an extra night but only room avail was the one we had, we were not sure but wanted a day to just relax at the pool, after a quick family discussion i went back to the front desk and they had given our room away in that hour, not very impressive when they knew we were looking at staying. We were at least given a late check out of 1pm and allowed to stay and use the facilities as long as we wanted, which we did until 4. Its worth staying here just for the ease of going to the parks, and you get complimentary express passes which make the extra cost of the hotel well worth it.
reviews.title: Great location, mixed feelings

reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and kept up well considering all of the people that must go through it. We were not happy with a couple of things. We wished there had been a regular fridge in the room that we could keep our own beverages cold instead of the stocked mini fridge. We were told the hotel would rent us a fridge, but we thought that was silly. The other complaint was the lack of free internet in our room, however we were told internet was free in the puplic areas of the hotel, but that is not always handy!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay and wonderful location to both Universal Parks.

reviews.text: We came with our two teenagers so the room was large enough to be comfortable and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful! Not sure I would come back or recommend it to other families because of the two complaints.
reviews.title: It's a Vacation, and Hard Rock Rocks!

reviews.text: This is our favorite hotel in Orlando. Just expect to pay, and pay, and pay... Parking is $18 a day, and that is not valet. Everything is expensive, so if value is an issue, stay elsewhere. That being said, you have unlimited express passes to all Universal attractions, and that is worth the cost of the hotel. The hotel is frankly the coolest ever. Children and teenagers are going to love it. It is not elegant, so don't expect it to be. It is fun, with loads of rock memorabilia everywhere. The staff is quite eager to please, for the most part. The beds are hard as a rock, so they fit the hotel name. This is a place to stay for the proximity to Universal, for the decor, for the activities and for the kids. There are dive in movies, music in the pool and yes, your kids will feel like rock stars. For parents, that is usually enough. Emack and Bolio's has fabulous ice cream, and yes, it it pricey. The food is very expensive, and not award winning.
reviews.title: Not as good second time around.

reviews.text: We had some very good and not so good experiences. We had stayed here last September and it was so good we came back for extra nights this July. Had we not had such a great experience in September we may not have expected as much this time around.
reviews.title: First Time Experiencing this Hotel
Nice place
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights with my family while visiting the IOA and US. Express pass is great; but does not work with main Harry Potter ride at IOA and Rockit at US. Both rides are really cool; actually liked Rockit the best. Service is very good; agree the rooms and hotel are showing their age, but we came for the Express Pass and hip music for my boys. Had room with two queens and barely fit in it with 2 adults and 2 kids. Hallways are long and we were far from the lobby but turned out to be close to the walking path to the parks and pool entrance. Often can be hard getting a shady chair at pool as they jam so many chairs on top of each other that you never feel like you have any personal space. DJ was fantastic. Glad he did not actually use his college education because he is very funny as is his brother. Was concerned that the music would be too loud based on the reviews here, but it was perfect and not too loud at all. Sorta stinks the pool is so shallow but this seems common in FL. Have stayed at the Portofino a few times and this is clearly more fun and closer to the parks (walking distance). We even used the pedicabs several times as we thought this was fun and helped when the dogs were hurting.

My husband and I traveled to Universal with our 2 teenage boys (17&15). Hotel is in a great location, easy walk to both parks and Citywalk. We usually don't squeeze into 1 room but we got a standard room and it was do-able. We did get a cot for $25 extra per night which was not very comfortable, but the boys took turns and it was better than them sharing a bed.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.text: Food at the restaurants at the hotel was very good, never had a bad meal. The Kitchen restaurant was great, the pretzel bread was a favorite! We dined at the Palm one evening, very pricey but excellent food and service. The Palm bar was great for the adults, we met some other couples and had a wonderful evening eating at the bar, watching the olympics and chatting with the bartender (Tracey was great!).
reviews.title: Hard rock place to be

reviews.text: The best thing about staying here is the fastpasses you get for Universal Studios. I don't think we could have done the parks without them. At this time of year the ride lines were very long. We got through each ride easily and made withstanding the heat of the day that much easier.
reviews.title: Doesn't get much better than this!

reviews.text: I spent a day at the pool also. Very nice pool area. Pool was very clean for the amount of people in it. The only downside to the pool is that it is very shallow, which is great for kids but it would have been nice to be able to be in water deeper than 3 1/2 feet. It is a graduated entrance to the pool so it was easy to lay down in the water. My younger son enjoyed the waterslide, and the afternoon dj was great and kept everyone entertained. It appeared the younger kids would have a great time playing pool games. The drinks were good, although they probably could have used a few more servers. I had to track them down each time I wanted something. I only saw the waiter about 3 times in the 7 hours I was at the pool which was surprising. One thing that impressed me was that they added in 18% service charge at the pool, which is understandable, but they made a point of telling us to make it clear the service charge was added. Many times they conveniently forget to tell you this, but it let me know this hotel was not trying to pull anything over on you which was great.
reviews.title: Good hotel for parks and location

description: Live like a rock 'n' roll superstar at the exciting Hard Rock Hotel at Universal Orlando® You’ll feel like rock 'n' roll royalty with impeccable accommodations, a wealth of recreation and personal service and attention fit for an "A-List" celebrity. The Hard Rock Hotel is lively, yet laid back. Classy, yet totally casual, with a sand beach pool that immerses you in sound, not just water; authentic rock 'n' roll memorabilia; the legendary Palm Restaurant and more. You don't have to be a rock star to stay at Hard Rock Hotel. But after just a few hours, you’ll definitely get used to living the lifestyle.Hotel guests also enjoy an exclusive package of theme park benefits, including:* Early Park Admission† to Islands of Adventure, one hour before the theme park opens (valid theme park admission required)* Universal Express ride access* to skip the regular lines throughout both theme parks - a FREE benefit worth up to $87 per person, per day (valid theme park admission required) * Complimentary water taxis or shuttle buses to make getting around the resort fast and easy so you can make the most of your time* And more.
